official-title.#text: To require upon request a probable cause hearing in connection with property seizures relating to certain monetary instruments transactions.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Taxpayer Protections Against Abusive Seizures Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Taxpayer Protections Against Abusive Seizures Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Probable cause hearing in connection with property seizures relating to certain monetary instruments transactions

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , with respect to an alleged violation of
, shall be returned unless the court holds an adversarial hearing and finds within 14 days of such request that there is probable cause to believe that there is a violation of such

text.#text: If a hearing by a court of competent jurisdiction is requested within 14 days after the date on which notice is provided under subsection (b), property seized or restrained pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , of the rights of such person under subsection (a).

text.#text: Notice shall be provided to each person from whom property is seized or restrained pursuant to
Subsections (a) and (b) shall apply with respect to property seized or restrained after the date of the enactment of this Act.
